scripts.name: Title Animator
scripts.rawScript:
:loop
wait 10

// M
change brightwhite invisiblewall breakablewall
wait 1
change brightwhite breakablewall wall
wait 1
change brightwhite wall solidwall
wait 5

// I
change brightgreen invisiblewall breakablewall
wait 1
change brightgreen breakablewall wall
wait 1
change brightgreen wall solidwall
wait 5

// N
change yellow invisiblewall breakablewall
wait 1
change yellow breakablewall wall
wait 1
change yellow wall solidwall
wait 5

// E
change brightcyan invisiblewall breakablewall
wait 1
change brightcyan breakablewall wall
wait 1
change brightcyan wall solidwall
wait 5

// S
change brightmagenta invisiblewall breakablewall
wait 1
change brightmagenta breakablewall wall
wait 1
change brightmagenta wall solidwall
wait 5

// OF
change brightred invisiblewall breakablewall
wait 1
change brightred breakablewall wall
wait 1
change brightred wall solidwall

wait 20

// Change back
change brightwhite solidwall wall
change brightgreen solidwall wall
change yellow solidwall wall
change brightcyan solidwall wall
change brightmagenta solidwall wall
change brightred solidwall wall
wait 1
change brightwhite wall breakablewall
change brightgreen wall breakablewall
change yellow wall breakablewall
change brightcyan wall breakablewall
change brightmagenta wall breakablewall
change brightred wall breakablewall
wait 1
change breakablewall invisiblewall
wait 10
send loop

tiles.text: Ammo Shack - Touch the door to enter.

Caution: The JZT Mining Society has received reports of increased lion sightings in the area. Lions look like this: Ω
Should you see one, do not touch it. Instead, please call the Inexplicable Non-Native Wildlife Hotline by dialling 0 on your rotary phone. Or shoot it. Thank you!

scripts.name: Itinerant Script
scripts.rawScript:
:loop
	if aligned n checkammo
    send loop

:loop
	end
    
:checkammo
	zap loop
	if ammo <= 0 holler
    play "1"
    say "\"Hey, down here!\""
    end
    
:holler
	play "1"
	scroll bold "A nearby man hollers to you..."
    scroll "Hey, adventurer! Down here! Before continuing, aren't you going to check out what's in that hut to the west? That hut is full of ammo, and you're going to need it."
    end

:enter
   if kindness >= 1 vanish
   send loop
   
:vanish
   die

:touch
   play "tfxexdxex+c"
   scroll bold "A weathered and unkempt man speaks:"
   scroll "Why hello there, young adventurer. You wouldn't happen to have a couple of gems to spare for a weathered and unkempt fellow such as myself, would you?"
   scroll "Donate some gems" donate
   scroll "Not right now" nothing
   end
   
:donate
   take 2 gems toopoor
   zap touch
   give 1 kindness

:touch
   say "Thank you, kind stranger!"
   end
   
:toopoor
   scroll "It looks like you don't have any gems yet. That's understandable, since you just started adventuring."
   scroll "By the way, thanks for pushing some of those arrow-shaped blocks out of the way for me. Depending on their shape, they can only be pushed in certain directions, and I've been too weak to do it myself."
   end

:nothing
   scroll "Well, I'll be here if you ever change your mind."
   end

scripts.name: Scroll Script
scripts.rawScript:
end

:touch
   play "ga#g#+c-a#+dcd#df--ga#g#+c-a#+dcd#dfd-a#+fd+a#f+a#"
   scroll bold "Welcome, Adventurer!"
   scroll "Your quest has taken you here, to the outskirts of an old, low-resolution mining town known as The Mines of JZT."
   scroll "This region once produced over 78% of all videogame gems, but over-mining has left the underground caverns barren... or so they say."
   scroll "ANSI Geologists have recently found evidence that vast caverns of untold wealth lay mere kilobytes below our feet. These riches are just waiting to be discovered by a resourceful adventurer, and--as it turns out--you just might be up to the task!"
   scroll "All you need to do is explore and find what you need to unlock the treasure chambers. Fame surely awaits you if you succeed!"
   scroll "Of course, there are a few things you should know before embarking on such a perilous journey..."
   scroll bold "Exploring"
   scroll "The world of JZT is full of strange and wonderful items. If you don't know what something is, try touching it. As someone once said, the worst that can happen is DEATH."
   scroll bold "Your health"
   scroll "You begin your quest with a paltry 50 health points, which will be reduced by 10 each time you're injured. Once you reach 0 health points, I'm afraid it's curtains for you and your adventure!"
   scroll "You can recover health by collecting gems (1 point each), up to your maximum. There are also several hearts hidden throughout the mines which will increase your maximum health by 10 points each--if you're lucky enough to find them."
   scroll bold "Defending yourself"
   scroll "To survive in this 8-bit land, you're going to need a weapon. Luckily, you've got your trusty zapper by your side! Less luckily, it seems, your zapper needs ammunition, and you're going to have to find it."
   scroll "Once you've got ammo, you can shoot by holding down the SPACE key and pressing an ARROW key in the direction you want to shoot. Easy, right?"
   scroll bold "Saving your game"
   scroll "Of course, you should expect to meet an unfortunate demise when embarking on such a perilous journey. To avoid having to restart from the beginning, it would be wise to save your progress regularly, and with multiple save files."
   scroll "Save your game by pressing the [S] key at any time during your adventure. It is strongly recommended to keep several save points throughout your journey. It's possible to find yourself stuck and unable to continue, so saving often may be your only chance for success!"
   scroll bold "Best of luck, adventurer!"
   scroll bold "You'll need it!"
   end

scripts.name: Target Script
scripts.rawScript:
end

// When shot, react like a target
:shot
   zap shot
   play "--c"
   say "A direct hit!"
   end
   
:shot
   zap shot
   play "--c"
   say "Bullseye!"
   end
   
:shot
   zap shot
   play "--c"
   say "You've done this before, haven't you?"
   end
   
:shot
   restore shot
   restore shot
   restore shot
   play "--c"
   say "OK, now you're just showing off."
   end
   
   
// When touched, identify
:touch
   scroll "It's a shooting target. And there's a note attached."
   scroll "\"Take a few steps back, line yourself up with the target, then hold down SPACE and tap an ARROW key to shoot in that direction.\""
   scroll "Seems straightforward enough, I suppose."
   end

scripts.name: Young Girl Script
scripts.rawScript:
end

:touch
	play "+bxaxbx+cxdxxx-dxxxg"
	scroll bold "A little girl speaks:"
	scroll "Oh, hiya mister!"
	scroll "I want to feed Mrs. Duck because she's been swimming in the pond all day and looks hungry, but I'm out of bread and my mom says I shouldn't waste it on ducks and I'm not allowed to use the bread oven and I don't have any ingredients anyway and I was wondering if I could borrow some bread so then I can feed it to Mrs. Duck so she can eat the bread so she won't get so tired swimming."
    scroll bold "The girl takes a deep breath and continues..."
	scroll "So whatdayasay, mister? Do you have some bread you could give to me so I can feed Mrs. Duck?"
    scroll "Sure, why not?" givebread
	scroll "Sorry, not right now." nobread
	end
   
:givebread
	scroll "Oh, but it looks like you don't have any bread."
    scroll "Thanks anyway, mister. I'm sorry that you don't care about Mrs. Duck."
   	end
   
:nobread
	scroll "Aw, shucks, mister... Not even a little?"
    scroll "Mrs. Duck might starve!"
    end
    
:hysterics
	lock
    wait 2
    scroll bold "The little girl screams loudly"
    scroll "Mrs. Duck!? Mrs. Duck!? Mister! You... You shot Mrs. Duck!"
    scroll bold "The girl runs home, sobbing uncontrollably."
    wait 1
    go e 2, n 5, e 1
    send door unlock
    wait 3
    go w 1, n 3, w 4
    zap touch
    unlock
    end
    
:touch
	scroll "I have nothing more to say to you, you... you... duck murderer!"
    end

scripts.name: Townsperson
scripts.rawScript:
:loop
   go randf
   wait 3
   send loop
   
:touch
   play "-dxxgxbxxxxdxxxxg"
   send advice
   
:advice
   scroll "Howdy, stranger!"
   scroll "Welcome to Schlorb.. blorgensh... blorsh--Welcome to our town!"
   scroll "We get a lot of adventurers in these parts. I assume you're after the fabled treasure? Well, I'd give up now if I were you. Don't get me wrong: This adventure is almost certain to be filled with puzzles, action, and nostalgia-inducing fun, but the graphics are also pretty dull and the sound is virtually non-existant."
   scroll "Of course, if you are planning on seeking the treasure, you should stop at the store to stock up on a few things. Especially torches. The mines are dark, after all, and this adventure will be practically impossible without a good number of torches."
   scroll "Oh, and if you ever need more advice, feel free to ask me anytime. It's great to have new adventurers in town!"
   zap advice
   send loop
   
:advice
   scroll "If you ever have any questions about spelunking, the old miner up north is bound to have some good advice. He's probably the only miner left in this town these days..."
   zap advice
   send loop
   
:advice
   scroll "If you're looking for some bread, there's a bakery at the north part of town. I haven't seen them carry it in stock for a while now, though."
   zap advice
   send loop
   
:advice
   scroll "There's some trees outside of town that you won't be able to pass easily. If you had a weapon that fired red hot bullets, you might be able to burn through them, though."
   restore advice
   restore advice
   restore advice
   send loop

scripts.name: Hermit
scripts.rawScript:
:loop
	try randf
    wait 3
    send loop

:touch
	zap touch
	play "cxxxcxexgxxxexxx+c"
	scroll bold "The man speaks..."
    scroll "Hello there, adventurer! My name is Danicoldorphenslarto, but you can call me Danicoldorphenslar."
    scroll "This is my home. It's just outside of the mining town of Shorbenblibbers, located one screen to the East. I'm trying to start a new suburb."
    scroll "Have you thought about the benefits of living outside of town? It's great! A bit more peaceful, a bit less expensive, and there's a mysterious pipe that spews unspeakable putridity into the nearest pond hourly."
    scroll "OK, that last point might sound like a knock against my sales pitch here, but I'm required to disclose it. It's really not that bad unless you're into swimming or inhaling through your nose."
    scroll "By the way, you should speak to me again. I might say something different."
    send loop
    
:touch
	restore touch
    scroll bold "Danicoldorphenslar continues..."
    scroll "While you're here, here's a tip about exploring life outside of town:"
    scroll "This world is dangerous. Like, really super-mega-treacherous. It's almost like this whole world was developed before good game design practices were commonplace. Adventuring here means coming to peace with the idea that it will be possible to get totally stuck, \"soft-locked\" if you will, and unable to continue. For this reason, I encourage everyone looking to live outside of town to save regularly across MULTIPLE save slots."
    scroll "Look, I know it sounds scary, but do this and you'll PROBABLY be fine: Press the [S] key to save, and the [R] key to restore a saved game."
    send loop

scripts.name: Treasure Guy
scripts.rawScript:
walk e
end

:thud
   walk opp flow
   end
   
:touch
   play "s+f#ab+c#-f#a+c#d-f#ab+c#-f#ab+c#-df#a+c#-f#a+c#d-f#ab+c#-f#ab+c#"
   scroll bold "A scary-looking man stares at you intensely and with purpose, as if he's about to deliver an important bit of exposition..."

scripts.name: Truffle Picker
scripts.rawScript:
end
:touch
	zap touch
	play "-exgxaxgxexxx-a+xxxe"
	if not exists lion thank
	scroll bold "You approach the frightened wanderer..."
    scroll "Thank goodness you're here! I was out searching for truffles, when I found myself surrounded by ferocious lions. Lions! In these parts!"
    scroll "I've only got 23 health points left, so I can't possibly risk taking on these lions myself. I can see from your detailed graphics that you're carrying a deadly weapon. Could you please shoot all the lions for me, so I can return to town and recover my health safely?"
    scroll "Oh, and how do I know how much health I've got left? Simple! I just press [ENTER] or [P] to pause the game; it shows me all kinds of useful stats!"
    end
    
:touch
	restore touch
	play "-exgxaxgxexxx-a+xxxe"
	if not exists lion thank
    scroll bold "You approach the frightened wanderer..."
    scroll "If only there weren't so many lions around, I could search for truffles in peace. Please help me!"
    end
    
:thank
	zap thank
    restore touch
    play "-exgx+ax-gxex"
	if health < 50 heal
	scroll bold "The wanderer lets out a sigh of relief..."
    scroll "Thank you for taking care of all the lions for me. It means a lot, truly. And you've still got full health after the job! Impressive."
    scroll "Have some extra rounds of ammo on me. And don't forget: Press [ENTER] or [P] at any time to pause the game and check out your stats."
    give 50 ammo
    end
    
:heal
	scroll bold "The wanderer lets out a sigh of relief..."
    scroll "Thank you for taking care of all the lions for me. It means a lot, truly."
    scroll "It looks like you sustained some damage during the hunt! Here, I'll rub some of my special salve on your left eyelid, which should recover all of your health. Have a few rounds of ammo on me, too."
    scroll "And don't forget: Press [ENTER] or [P] at any time to pause the game and check out your stats."
    give 200 health
    give 20 ammo
    end
    
:thank
	say "Take care out there, adventurer!"
    end
    
:enter
	if firezapper > 0 leave
    end
    
:leave
	die

scripts.name: Guide
scripts.rawScript:
:enter
    set 1 guide
    zap touch
    zap touch
	if mineguide > 0 start
end
:start
    restore touch
    restore touch
    torch 3
end
:touch
    scroll bold "Murray, the experienced miner speaks."
	scroll "Ah, you made it! Although I'm not sure how I got here before you did, given that my joints just aren't what they used to be."
    scroll "I brought my torch, attached to my fantastically practical torch-carrying hook, just as promised. Be careful to follow closely or you'll be left behind in the dark!"
    scroll "These mines play tricks on you, so it's a good thing you've got an experienced guide like me here. I don't even want to think about what would have happened if you tried going at it alone."
    scroll "Anyway, enough chat. Are you ready?"
    scroll "Let's go!" leadtheway
    scroll "Not just yet." nope
    end
:nope
    say "Just let me know when you're ready."
    end
:leadtheway
	lock
    zap touch
    zap enter
    say "Follow me closely..."
    wait 3
    go e 6
    scroll bold "Murray stops suddenly."
    scroll "See this fork in the path? This is exactly why you need someone like me to guide you. If you were doing this on your own, you might have gone off straight to the east, and almost certainly to your peril!"
    scroll "Yes, that would have been very bad indeed."
    wait 1
    go s 7
    wait 3
    scroll bold "Murray stops"
    scroll "A... dead end?"
    scroll "Ah, yes. Of course. A dead end."
    scroll "I just, uh, thought you might want these gems before we continue. Gems give you health, you know."
    wait 4
    go n 7, e 8
    scroll bold "The miner stops, once again."
    scroll "Another fork in the road! You can expect a lot more of these ahead. The mines are extensive, and very, very treacherous..."
    wait 1
    go n, e, n, e 2, n, e 4
    go s, e 2, s, e, s 2
    go w, s, w 2, s, w 4
    go n, w 2, n, w, n
    scroll bold "You have a sense of déja-vu, but the miner continues..."
    scroll "You know, some people in town doubt my guiding abilities, but what do they know about mines? They just sit comfortably in their houses or stare at our town's only duck. Boring! If they'd just come down into the mines with me, they'd see what an adventure they're missing!"
    wait 1
    go n, e, n, e 2, n, e 4
    go s, e 2, s, e, s
    scroll bold "The miner sniffs the air."
    scroll "Smell that? It's the intoxicating scent of adventure! And it's just around the corner!"
    wait 1
    go e 12
    wait 3
    scroll bold "Murray looks around with an air of confusion..."
    scroll "Another dead end?"
    scroll "I could have sworn... Oh, wait, no, I remember now."
    wait 3
    go w 12
    scroll bold "Murray resumes..."
    scroll "Yes, yes, we should have gone north here, I'm certain of it."
    wait 1
    go n, w, n, w 2, n, w 4
    go s, w 2, s, w, s
    scroll bold "The miner stops unexpectedly."
    scroll "Whoops! My shoe's untied. Just a moment here..."
    wait 4
    say "There we go..."
    wait 3
    go w 8
    scroll bold "Murray continues babbling..."
    scroll "You know, when I was younger these caves weren't quite as extensive as they are today."
    scroll "Mining operations started back in nineteen-ought-three under the direction of Count Chuck the third. Of course, I (blah, blah, blah, blah...)"
    scroll "And who should take over the mining operations, but Miss Hollywood Glamour herself, Barbara Powers! I kid you not! This was a surprise to everyone, as she once told the count (blah, blah, blah, blah...)"
    scroll "Not that the princess would have wanted it any other way."
    scroll "Anyway, enough of this chit-chat. We need to make a left here."
    wait 1
    go s 7
    wait 2
    scroll bold "You both let out an exasperated sigh."
    scroll "DAGNABBIT!"
    scroll "You know, I had this feeling from the start: We've just been walking too quickly."
    scroll "Yes, that's definitely it. We can't be expected to find all the paths around here when continuing at such a brisk pace!"
    scroll "Let's take it more slowly from now on. Watch your step!"
    speed 8
    wait 3
    send wall2 vanish
    go n 7, e 8
    go s, e, s, e 2, s, e 2
    scroll bold "Murray smiles..."
    scroll "Ah, heh, bet you missed this path the last time, eh? What did I tell you?"
    wait 1
    go s 8
    scroll bold "You both stare blankly."
    scroll "OK, you know what?"
    scroll "I think that maybe, just perhaps I'm no longer the experienced spelunker I thought I was."
    scroll "I think you had better lead the way from here. I can follow right behind you with my torch."
    scroll "Given all the falling rocks we heard earlier, we should check to see if any new paths have opened. Lead the way!"
    send wall3 vanish
    speed 3
    unlock
:follow
	try smart
:loop
    if not peep 3 follow
    send loop
:touch
	try opp smart
    try opp seek
    send loop

scripts.name: Mine Guide
scripts.rawScript:
lock
torch 3
go n 3
scroll bold "Murray stops."
:touch
scroll "Do you hear running water? I have an uneasy feeling about this."
scroll "Maybe we should take it a bit slow here..."
unlock
end
:react
zap react
wait 1
scroll "Did... did those torches just light themselves?"
end
:sweptaway
lock
speed 1

scripts.name: Exposition
scripts.rawScript:
end

:touch
	scroll bold "You find an old, dusty scroll lying on the ground. It reads:"
    scroll "Journal Entry #32: After being swept away by a raging underground current, I've found myself alone in these mines without a guide. There are bears and spiders around every corner. I'm not sure how long I'll survive here."
    scroll "Thankfully these strange, self-lighting torches provide enough light to allow me to write in this journal. It keeps me sane, and gives me hope that someday, someone might know that I was here, and I can feel like I'm communicating with another person across time."
    scroll "I've lost track of how long I've been down here now, eating cave insects to survive, and drinking water that reeks of sulphur. I find my thoughts wandering, thinking about my life and what I should have done with it..."
    scroll "It's cruel how being this close to death finally gives me the perspective to understand what I should have done with my life. I wake up each new day... or possibly night (it's impossible to know the time here) and find myself occupied by a single regret:"
    scroll "If only I had created more value for our corporate investors."
    end

scripts.name: Mine Guide
scripts.rawScript:
torch 3
	scroll bold "Murray speaks:"
    scroll "These mines seem to have changed a lot since I was last here..."
    scroll "Make sure to take it slow and keep within my torch light at all times. Who knows what creatures live down here since the mine was abandoned?"
    send loop
:follow
	try smart
:loop
    if not peep 3 follow
    send loop
:touch
	try opp smart
    try opp seek
    send loop
:talkbars
	zap talkbars
    scroll bold "Murray looks puzzled."
    scroll "Strange. These bars aren't typical of this region's mining operations. We need to get past them somehow."
    send loop
:talkbars
	scroll "I don't think we'll be able to get past these bars like this. Let's keep exploring."
    send loop
:talkbutton
	lock
	zap talkbutton
	wait 3
    scroll "Did you hear that sound? I think it came from near where we entered."
    scroll "Keep on the lookout for more bears, too. I think I heard some right behind us..."
    unlock
    send loop
:talkbutton
	lock
    wait 3
    scroll "I heard another sound. Maybe another set of bars unlocked?"
    unlock
    send loop
:talkbear
	wait 3
    scroll "Whoa! Did you hear that? It sounded like something growling. There might be bears nearby..."
    scroll "If you see one, it might charge at us. Let's be careful!"
    scroll "It's in times like this that I used to save my game by pressing [S] on the keyboard. It's the secret to my long survival!"
    send loop
:talkdeadend
	zap talkdeadend
    say "A dead end. Sigh."
    send loop
:talkdeadend
	zap talkdeadend
    say "Another dead end?"
    send loop
:talkdeadend
	restore talkdeadend
    restore talkdeadend
    say "Yet another dead end, I see..."
    send loop
:talkcrossroads
	zap talkcrossroads
    say "Which way should we go?"
    send loop
:talkcrossroads
	zap talkcrossroads
    say "Another fork in the road..."
    send loop
:talkcrossroads
	restore talkcrossroads
    restore talkcrossroads
    say "So many directions to choose from!"
    send loop

    scroll "I'm sorry. *sniff* I really don't mean to cry in front of customers. It's my last day working here, ever since my shop was bought by VendCo Vending Solutions, Inc. - The world leader in automated vending products (tm)."

scripts.name: Miner
scripts.rawScript:
:loop
	try randf
    wait 8
    send loop
    
:touch
	play "f#xxxexexd#xxxc#xxx-b"
    if firezapper > 0 returned
	if torchhook > 0 gratitude
    if shacklight > 0 shackadvice
    if minequest > 0 findhook
	scroll "Greetings, adventurer! My name's Murray, and I'm the best, most experienced miner in these parts."
    scroll "I may not be as spry as I once was, but make no mistake -- I know these mines like the back of the hook where my left hand used to be." 
    scroll "It's a nice coincidence that you came here on the anniversary of the day I first became a miner. I'd be happy to accompany you into Tonka-Bonk mines, just west of town. It's been years since I've been there, and would love to re-live my mining days."
    scroll "The only problem is that I can't seem to find the torch-holding attachment for my hook. The mines are impossibly dark, and we won't be able to get very far if I can't carry my torch."
    scroll "Could you find my hook attachment for me? I think I left it somewhere in town."
    scroll "You bet!" ok
    scroll "Maybe later." later
    send loop

:ok
	set 1 minequest
	scroll "Fantastic! I'll be waiting right here."
    scroll "By the way, there's a key under the bathroom sink that might come in handy. It unlocks my shack on the south edge of town. Go ahead and take it."
    send loop
    
:later
	scroll "It's your decision. Although I don't think you'll be able to navigate the dark mines without an experienced guide like me..."
    send loop
    
:findhook
	scroll "Thanks again for agreeing to find my torch-carrying hook. I simply can't guide you through the mines without being able to carry a torch! The key underneath my bathroom sink might help you search."
    send loop
    
:shackadvice
	scroll "Have you found my torch-carrying hook yet? I may have left it in my shack at the south edge of town. The room is pretty dark, but if you turn on the light switch, it should be bright enough to find what you're looking for."
    send loop
    
:gratitude
	lock
    zap gratitude
    set 1 mineguide
    unlock
	scroll "Hey, you found my torch-holding hook attachment!"
:gratitude
    scroll "Now that I can hold a torch again, I'll guide you through the Tonka-bonk mines. I'll meet you there, just inside the mines. I just need a few moments to gather my things."
    scroll "You can find the mine entrance south west of town. You'll need a red key to get there, if you don't already have one."
    send loop
    
:returned
	scroll "You're alive! When I saw you get swept away by that underground river, I thought you were a goner."
    scroll "Given how scary that was, I think I'm considering myself retired from the mining business for good."
    scroll "Best of luck in the rest of your quest, Adventurer!"
    send loop

scripts.name: Torch Salesman
scripts.rawScript:
end

:touch
	play "cxxxgxfxxxexxxc"
	scroll bold "A sharply dressed man speaks..."
    scroll "Well, heya stranger! Welcome to the Tonka-Bonk torch outlet. We've got the best torches in all of JZT, and they're ridiculously cheap, too!"
    scroll "You're about to encounter a pretty difficult enemy, and I'd say it'd be darn near impossible to continue without a good supply of quality torches, so why not stock up now?"
    scroll "It's 20 torches for 20 gems. What a steal! What do you say?"
    scroll "Did you say enemy?" boss
    scroll "I'll take 'em!" buy
    scroll "Maybe later..." later
   	end
    
:boss
	scroll "Yeah, the treasure you're seeking in the depths of these caves is guarded by a giant spider or something."
    scroll "In addition to being crazily dark in here, interference from the cave prevents your zapper from firing any more than a couple of bullets at a time. How inconvenient!"
    scroll "Since it sounds overly difficult, I haven't attempted to fight it myself, but I figured it'd only be a matter of time before an adventurer came along, so I set up shop here."
    scroll "So what do you say? Are you ready to spend 20 gems for 20 torches?"
    scroll "I'll take 'em!" buy
    scroll "Maybe later..." later
 	end
    
:later
	say "OK; it's your funeral."
    end
    
:buy
	take 20 gems toopoor
    zap touch
    give 20 torches
    scroll "Good call! Here you go: 20 brand new torches, ready-to-use immediately."
    scroll "Using a torch is easy. press the [T] key, and it'll burn brightly for a few minutes. If it starts to get dim, you can press [T] again to light another."
    scroll "While you're pressing stuff on the keyboard, you might also want to hit [S] and save. These mines are dangerous, after all."
    scroll "And, adventurer: Good luck!"
    end
    
:touch
	scroll "Remember, press the [T] key to use a torch. Good luck!"
    end
    
:toopoor
	scroll "You don't have 20 gems? How is that even possible?"
    scroll "I'm feeling generous, and you need these torches to beat the game, so here's some gems. Sheesh."
    give 20 gems
    end

scripts.name: Diary
scripts.rawScript:
end
:touch
	scroll "It's a diary."
    scroll "Read it" read
    scroll "Leave it alone" leave
    end
    
:read
    scroll bold "You open the diary..."
    scroll "Dear Diary,"
    scroll "I'm trapped. Everything was going according to plan during the elevator shaft construction, when suddenly a group of boulders fell, snapping my saftey harness and sealing off the only way out."
    scroll "I can see some unexplored caverns ahead, but before going any further, I decided to start this diary. No time like the present, am I right?"
	scroll "Next page" page2
    scroll "Put it down" leave
    end
    
:page2
	scroll "Dear Diary,"
    scroll "I'm stoked about this whole diary project. I mean, it's pretty rad to think this might be read by an adventurer someday, kneeling beside my creepy-looking skeleton---eyeless sockets, lit by torchlight, making the terrifying exposition that I'm about to deliver that much more scary."
    scroll "I suppose I ought to actually find out what's ahead first. I see a narrow path around the bend; I'll check it out and report back tomorrow. Talk to you later, Diary!"
    scroll "Next page" page3
    scroll "Put it down" leave
    end
    
:page3
	scroll "Dear Diary,"
    scroll "I found out what's in the caverns ahead! And if anyone is reading this, HEED MY WARNING. You're in for some really awful stuff. True horrors."
    scroll "I hope my skeleton's death pose looks anguished. I'd hate if any of the chilling and horrible stuff I'm about to describe were diminished by a peaceful appearance."
	scroll "I suppose it all started when I noticed an eerie red glow..."
    scroll "Oh, but I gotta go! I said I'd meet Bat, my new friend who's also a bat, for squeaking practice. Talk to you later!"
    scroll "Next page" page4
    scroll "Put it down" leave
    end
    
:page4
	scroll "Dear Diary,"
    scroll "Bat and I got into a fight. It was pretty bad. I think I need to take a break from \"us\" for a bit."
    scroll "I just feel so smothered! Our squeaking practices used to be so much fun, but now he's all \"squeeeak screeee!\" and I'm like \"I CAN'T DO SONAR! YOU KNOW THAT!\""
    scroll "It's like he never really understood me at all."
    scroll "Keep reading" page5
    scroll "Put it down" leave
    end
    
:page5
	scroll "Dear Diary,"
    scroll "Have you ever wondered what happens when you dig too far down into the earth? Here's a hint: you find yourself somewhere really, really hot."
    scroll "Like, REALLY hot."
    scroll "That's right, The Underworld!"
    scroll "I wasn't prepared to believe my eyes, but then I started chatting with a tortured soul who was floating around the main gates on his smoke break."
    scroll "He was pretty chill. I mean, yeah, he warned me to go no further and to \"abandon all hope,\" but he also chatted at length about what it was like to be dead, about how he spends his days as mid-level manager at Styx Ferry Services, and how he occasionally goes on holiday to the surface, haunting colourful Gobi fish in some of the lesser-known reefs."
    scroll "He said that there's an ancient relic called the \"Charred Eye\" that Persephone keeps in a chamber below her office. But no adventurer would be able to get their hands on it, or even be able to escape."
    scroll "Anyway, that's all the exposition I have, and my pencil is down to a nub anyway. So, tell my family I love them, yada yada yada."
    scroll "P.S. While I prefer you don't disturb my remains, feel free to position my jaw to suggest a restless horror, if it's not already like that. Thanks a ton."
    scroll "--Marvin"
    end
:leave
	say "Too scared?"
    end

scripts.rawScript:
end
:touch

scroll bold "The man behind the counter speaks..."
scroll "Heya! Welcome to Samson's Bakery and 24 Hour Elevator Repair: Servicing the Schorbenblibbers community for over fifty-three days!"
scroll "\"How can I help you?\""
scroll "I need some bread" bread
scroll "I need an elevator repaired" repair
scroll "Nevermind" nevermind
end

:touch
play "fxxxfxgxaxxxgxxxf"
scroll "Hello again! What can I do for you?"

scroll "I need a sour raisin log" raisin
scroll "I need an elevator repaired" repair
scroll "Nevermind" nevermind
end

:bread
lock
zap touch
zap bread
unlock

:bread
if noduck > 0 baking
scroll "I'm afraid I no longer sell bread in this town. The townspeople here have a profound lack of appreciation for the baked arts."
scroll "It takes the finest ingredients, years of training, and countless hours to bake a loaf of bread, and what do the townspeople do with it? Feed it to ducks!"
scroll "Yes, as long as that stupid duck is in town, I refuse to bake another loaf. Of course, if you'd like a sour raisin log, I can help you out!"
end

:baking
scroll "Frankly, I'm a little too upset to bake right now. I heard an outsider came into down and shot our only duck. That duck was like a town mascot. It loved my bread."
scroll "What is this world coming to?"
end

:raisin
scroll "The sour raisin log; a fine choice!"
scroll "Only the most refined palates tend to appreciate this culinary masterpiece. The sourness of the dough brings out the natural acridity of fermented raisins, lending the finished product a sharp, malodorous quality that some might describe as earthy, bordering on feculent."
scroll "Given the amount of precision and skill it takes to produce, it should be ready for you early next week. No need to pay until then."
end

:repair
if elevatortools > 0 dorepair
if elevatorlicense > 0 tools
scroll "Of course. I'll just need the elevator's license identifier and my elevator repair tools."
end

:tools 
   lock
   zap tools
   send door open
   unlock
   
:tools
   scroll bold "Samson takes a look at your elevator license papers..."
   scroll "Ah, so elevator 24601 has broken again. It's almost certainly a blown fuse; it always is. I can repair it for you, but I'll need my elevator repair tools. They're in my tool shed, located in my back garden."
   scroll "I'd go and get the tools myself, but the garden has been overrun by snakes, and I'm too terrified of them to approach."
   scroll "Could you go and grab the tools from my shed for me? You can use this key from behind the counter."
   end
   
:dorepair
   lock
   scroll "Samson speaks..."
   scroll "You found my elevator repair tools! Good for you."
   scroll "I've got everything I need to do the repair now. Watch how fast I move!"
   wait 5
   set elevatorrepaired

scripts.name: Vendor
scripts.rawScript:
:loop
	try rand
    wait 2
    send loop
    
:touch
	play "sed#ef#gf#ga#qbs0x000"
	scroll bold "The restauranteur speaks..."
	scroll "Hey, traveller! It's been a while since I've seen a mortal around here."
    scroll "Thanks for stopping by! We've got all kinds of unique underworld food that you can't find anywhere else. It's amazing stuff, really spectacular."
    scroll "Before I show you the menu, I'm required to ask if you've heard of the Law of Abode?"
    
    scroll "No, I haven't." explain
    scroll "As a matter of fact, yes." acknowledge
    send loop
    
:explain
	restore touch
	scroll bold "The restauranteur sighs..."
    scroll "The Law of Abode? It's nothing of particular importance. Just a minor point, really. I don't even know why I'm required to bring it up."
    scroll "It's a silly little law pertaining to food and drink. Boring, right? Bureaucracy. Blech! I'm sure you don't want me to explain a really dull law explaining how eating or drinking anything while in Hades means you can never return to the surface and effectively ends your game."
    scroll "Look, it's much easier if you'd just verbally waive my legal liability."

    scroll "Uh, this sounds scary." no
    scroll "Yeah, yeah, whatever." acknowledge
  	send loop
    
:no
	scroll bold "The restauranteur sighs..."
    scroll "Alright, well please come back if you change your mind. Our food may have other uses beyond being eaten!"
    send loop
    
:acknowledge
	zap touch
	scroll bold "The restauranteur continues..."
    scroll "Ah, excellent! My legal liability is waived."
    
:touch
    scroll "Can I interest you in anything?"
    scroll "Pasta El Dante....... 5 gems" pasta
    scroll " - The underworld's finest pasta! Recovers 25 health. (Note: This food contains ingredients that The State of Hades recognizes as consequential to one's freedom. Caution is strongly recommended.)"
    scroll "Golden Pomegranate... 100 gems" health
    scroll " - Not technically edible, but touching it will recover ALL of your health! To be clear, I'm not actually SELLING it, but for 100 gems you can touch it. It's a pretty good deal!"
    scroll "Steak Tartarus....... 5 gems" torches
    scroll " - Doesn't recover any health, and it's not very delicious, so you probably won't want to eat it, but it comes with five free torches."
    scroll "Free pretzels........ Free" ammo
    scroll "- Unpleasantly dry and inedible, but you can use it as ammo. On the house. Come back as often as you need to."
    scroll "About that Law..." explain
    send loop
    
:pasta
	take 5 gems toopoor
    play "8887"
    scroll bold "You order the pasta el Dante."
    scroll "It smells great, but that government warning sounds pretty scary. Are you sure you want to eat it? I'm pretty sure doing so means Game Over."
    scroll "Eat it anyway" gameover
    scroll "On second thought..."  donteat
    
:donteat
    say "Better safe than sorry."
    send loop
    
:gameover
	scroll "A voice booms out:"
    scroll bold "ADVENTURER, BY ALLOWING FOOD OR DRINK TO PASS YOUR LIPS WITHIN THE REALM OF HADES, YOU ARE FOREVER DOOMED TO REMAIN IN THE UNDERWORLD."
	set 0 health
    send loop
    
:health
	take 100 gems toopoor
	play "t---3ceg+3ceg+3ceg+3ceg+3ceg+3ceg+3ceg"
	say "There you go. Enjoy!"
	give 1000 health
    send loop
    
:torches
	take 5 gems toopoor
	play "tcase"
	give 5 torches
	say "Enlightening choice. Enjoy!"
    send loop
    
:ammo
	if ammo >= 150 enough
    play "tcc#dxcc#dxcc#d"
    give 100 ammo
    say "Enjoy, I guess..."
    send loop
    
:toopoor
	say "You don't have enough gems, friend."
    end
    
:enough
	play "t---cx00"
	say "You've got enough already. Come back later."
    send loop

scripts.name: Notary
scripts.rawScript:
:loop
	try rand
    wait 1
    send loop
    
:touch
    play "cxfxaxxxa#xaxgxxx+cxdxcxxxf"
	scroll bold "The notary speaks..."
    scroll "Pleasure to meet you. The name's Themis."
    scroll "My primary service is to seal legal documents with a thousand souls. This contraption here is the SoulSealer9000. Beauty, isn't she? Before this baby existed, sealing legal documents with a thousand souls would have taken a century or more, but this will do it in just under 3 decades!"
    scroll "In full disclosure: I'm facing a bit of a soul shortage at the moment. I've got 990 souls bottled up and ready to go in storage, but need ten more, so you'll also need to bring me those."
    scroll "Do you have any documents that need sealing?"
    scroll "As a matter of fact..." document
    scroll "Not at the moment." nope
    send loop
    
:touch
	say "I'm here if you need anything else."
    send loop
 
:nope
	scroll bold "Themis responds..."
	scroll "Well, if you ever find yourself in need of my service, you know where to go: Straight to hell! Heh, just little underworld humour there. Seriously though, I'm happy to help any time you need me."
    send loop
    
:document
	if permission > 0 gotdocument
    scroll bold "Themis reaches forward..."
    scroll "Fantastic! Hand me the document you need sealed."
    scroll "What's that? You don't actually have it yet? Well, no worries; come to me when you've got it."
    scroll "OK" loop
    send loop
    
:gotdocument
	scroll bold "Themis' eyes light up..."
    scroll "What a rare document! Hades has such exquisite handwriting. It's going to be an honour to seal it in the screams of a thousand souls for you."
    scroll "Speaking of which, do you have the ten additional souls I need to seal the document?"
    scroll "As a matter of fact, yes!" souls
    scroll "About that..." nope
    send loop
    
:souls
	if bottle <= 0 nobottle
    if souls = 0 nosouls
    if souls >= 10 doit
    scroll bold "Themis glows with excitement..."
    scroll "Let's take a look in that bottle, then!"
    scroll "Hmm... It doesn't look like there's quite ten in there yet. Keep searching, though! As soon as you've found ten souls, I can seal your document!"
    scroll "OK" loop
    send loop
    
:nobottle
	scroll bold "Themis looks puzzled..."
    scroll "It looks like you don't even have a bottle to hold the souls, let alone the ten souls I need to seal anything."
    scroll "I'll tell you what: Go ahead and take an empty bottle from my storage room. You can return it when you've got the ten souls."
    scroll "OK" loop
    send loop

:nosouls
	scroll bold "Themis peers in your bottle..."
    scroll "It looks like your bottle is still empty. Keep searching for those souls! There's bound to be some in the Asphodel Housing Projects."
    scroll "OK" loop
    send loop
    
:doit
	lock
    zap touch
    zap touch
    scroll bold "You hand Themis your bottle of ten souls..."
    scroll "Amazing work, adventurer!"
    scroll "Alright, I'll just pop these in the SoulSealer9000 here."
    unlock
    walk w
    end
    
:thud
	zap thud
	walk n
    end
    
:thud
	lock
    stand
    zap thud
	go e
    wait 5
    send SoulMachine Seal
    say "(The machine starts to move...)"
    wait 15
    say "(Several decades pass...)"
    wait 15
    send SoulMachine done
    wait 5
    scroll bold "Themis smiles"
    scroll "It's done! Your notarized document, sealed in the screams of a thousand souls is ready. Go ahead and take it."
    scroll "Take care out there, adventurer!"
    restore touch
    unlock
    send loop

    scroll "Adventurer, welcome. I am the Soul Counter. It is my purpose to account for each soul in this realm."

:touch
	if sealedpermission > 0 permission
    if bottle <= 0 nobottle
    if souls = 1 soul1
    if souls = 2 soul2
    if souls = 3 soul3
    if souls = 4 soul4
    if souls = 5 soul5
    if souls = 6 soul6
    if souls = 7 soul7
    if souls = 8 soul8
    if souls = 9 soul9
    if souls >= 10 soul10
    play "9"
    scroll "I see you carry an empty vessel. Curious."
    end
    
:nobottle
	play "---c"
	scroll "You possess no souls but your own, and only a corporal vessel. A tourist? Interesting."
    scroll "Come back if you need me to account for any souls you carry."
    end

	play "09"
	scroll "I see you carry a vessel containing a single soul. A fine and lonely place to rest."
    end

	play "009"
	scroll "I see you have two souls bottled up. For which purpose? I am uninterested."
    end

    scroll "You are in possession of three souls. A crowd."
    end
    
:soul4

    scroll "Your vessel contains four souls. They are neither willing nor unwilling; a perfect state of being, don't you agree?"
    end
    
:soul5

    scroll "Half empty or half full, your vessel contains five souls, five short of its capacity."
    end
    
:soul6

    end
    
:soul7

    scroll "Your vessel contains seven souls, a sacred number, but I sense it's short of your intended purpose."
    end
    
:soul8
	play "000000009"
    scroll "You have eight souls accompanying you in a bottle. This pastime is unusual for a tourist, but all are accounted for."
    end
    
:soul9

    scroll "You have nine souls bottled in a vessel with you. I sense that your collection is nearly complete, but for what purpose?"
    end
    
:soul10
	play "00000000009"
    scroll "Your vessel contains ten souls, and cannot hold more. I sense a feeling of accomplishment in you, yet the balance in Hades is unchanged."
    scroll "Here, all accomplishments are meaningless."
    end

    scroll "My records are both complete and forever incomplete."
    end

Basement Level 1: Maintenance Staff Only.
Note: All staff must SAVE their game at this point! For safety, the West Stairwell door is pressurized to our water system. Please ensure adequate pressure to activate the safety latch.
If any segment of pipe looks out of place, gently push it back to its proper location until it turns the correct color.
Caution: This building has been condemned and evacuated due to unsafe conditions. Trespassing is prohibited.

scripts.name: Elevator Controller
scripts.rawScript:
:loop
	if aligned w start
	send loop
    
:start
	if bottle <= 0 loop
    say "The elevator shifts suddenly..."
    change GeoFence grey linewall
    send Elevator up
    send Elevator torch
	play "002"
    wait 10
    play "---cxccd#xef#gg#"
    say "\"Going up.\""
    wait 5
    set 63 elevatorSteps
    
:loopa
	wait 5
	take 1 elevatorSteps done
    if elevatorSteps <= 42 loopb
    play "---c"
    send Elevator up
    send loopa

:loopb
	wait 30
    
:loopc
	wait 5
	give 1 elevatorSteps
    if elevatorSteps >= 52 loopd
    play "----c"
    send Elevator down
    send loopc
    
:loopd
	wait 50

:loope
	wait 5
	take 1 elevatorSteps done
    if elevatorSteps <= 22 loopf
    play "---c"
    send Elevator up
    send loope
    
:loopf
	wait 50
    
:loopg
	wait 5
	take 1 elevatorSteps done
    if elevatorSteps <=2 looph
    play "---c"
    send Elevator up
    send loopg
    
:looph
	wait 50
    
:loopi
	wait 5
    give 1 elevatorSteps
    if elevatorSteps >= 15 loopj
    play "----c"
    send Elevator down
    send loopi
    
:loopj
	wait 60

:loopk
	wait 5
    take 1 elevatorSteps done
    play "---c"
    send Elevator up
    send loopk
    
:done
	play "---cxdd#exe#xxcdd#d#"
	say "\"Eleventh floor.\""
    send Elevator untorch
    change spinninggun empty
    end

☼ ELECTRICAL ROOM ☼
For your safety, the electrical panels are secured behind safety foam that can only be removed with bomb explosions.
‼ WARNING: The bombs supplied in this room are special electrical bombs, and will explode IMMEDIATELY when electrified. Only touch them while in their inactive state to start the countdown.
‼ EXTRA WARNING: Do not bomb the purple security sentinels, or they will defend themselves aggressively.

    lock

    scroll "On behalf of all civilization that has ever existed or will ever exist for all of time, you are owed immense gratitude and reverence for your accomplishments."

        give 10 score

    give 10000 score

    wait 15
    victory

    send loop
